cons: It might make the symptoms of Parkinson's disease worse. so it is advisable for Perkinson's patients to avoid it
description: Cherimoya is a good source of potassium, fiber, manganese, phosphorus, zinc, copper, iron and calcium.
Vitamin C in cherimoya prevents free radicals from attacking the lipids, thus promoting cardiovascular health.
It reduces bad cholesterol (LDL) and increases good cholesterol (HDL) levels in the blood.
This improves the blood flow in the heart, reducing the risk of heart attacks.
Vitamin B6 in cherimoya is required for the proper functioning of our metabolism and immune system.
